item.title: CloudFormation to Build a CDN with (Free) Custom SSL -- Serverless Code
item.description:
CloudFormation to Build a CDN with (Free) Custom SSL -- Serverless Code

Recently, Amazon announced free SSL certs via AWS Certificate Manager, or ACM. This week, we'll use CloudFormation to provision ACM certificates automatically. I built my own custom ACM resource in Python. With this resource, you can configure a CloudFront distribution for your static content and get a custom SSL for your domain.

item.title: Rocana Offers 1TB of Free Daily IT Monitoring, Analytics - RTInsights
item.description:
Rocana Offers 1TB of Free Daily IT Monitoring, Analytics - RTInsights

A T-Mobile for IT monitoring? Rocana announced Feb. 2 that it will offer a free 1 TB of daily data volume for its IT monitoring and analytics platform, Rocana Ops. The company announced that the free 1 TB, available through Rocana One, will not be handicapped by functionality and scalability limits that come with other "free" offers.

item.title: Containers as a Service (CaaS) as your new platform for application development and operations
item.description:
Containers as a Service (CaaS) as your new platform for application development and operations

Developers don't adopt locked down platforms. That one simple statement summarizes decades of tension between IT operations and development teams. Along the spectrum of control versus agility are the desires and needs of IT operations teams responsible for keeping environments up and running and compliant to regulations and the needs of developers who are responsible for building software to attract, engage and maintain customers.

item.title: Continuous Delivery: Getting code where it needs to go - SD Times
item.description:
Continuous Delivery: Getting code where it needs to go - SD Times

DevOps is about more than getting development and operation teams to work together. It is a philosophy to get teams to embrace collaboration, ship code faster, and be more responsive to the market. And just working together isn't enough to achieve that goal.

item.title: A Short Manual to Bring Change Successfully Into Your Team
item.description:
A Short Manual to Bring Change Successfully Into Your Team

A short manual to bring change successfully into your team Implementing the DevOps philosophy in a team means a lot more than just changing the general set-up of the actual working conditions. Bringing a number of tools into the team's workflow won't solve the individual issues, because a team exists and works thanks to the interaction between human beings, not tools.

item.title: awslabs/aws-shell
item.description:
awslabs/aws-shell

aws-shell - An integrated shell for working with the AWS CLI.

item.title: Overcoming the business and technology barriers to DevOps adoption
item.description:
Overcoming the business and technology barriers to DevOps adoption

The topic of DevOps has dominated discussions at many of the major IT conferences this year, with suppliers and analysts lining up to warn enterprises about the business risks of failing to adopt a more agile approach to software development.

item.title: How to use customer feedback to drive your DevOps teams
item.description:
How to use customer feedback to drive your DevOps teams

DevOps and the cloud, the dominant topics in enterprise management discussions, are increasingly forcing R&D and operations leaders to rethink software delivery. Legacy methods just don't cut it anymore. They're too cumbersome, expensive, and disconnected from customers. So what do you do?

item.title: Love DevOps? Wait 'till you meet SRE
item.description:
Love DevOps? Wait 'till you meet SRE

You may have heard of a little company called Google. They invent cool stuff like driverless cars and elevators into outer space. Oh: and they develop massively successful applications like Gmail, Google Docs, and Google Maps. It's safe to say they know a thing or two about successful application development, right?

item.title: Newly minted DevOps consultancy roams world, looking for CIOs in pain
item.description:
Newly minted DevOps consultancy roams world, looking for CIOs in pain

London-based DevOps consultancy Contino has merged with a US-based counterpart with the combined entity getting a $30m cash boost from investment group Columbia Capital. The combined group will be making a play for the digital transformation business that has become an increasingly lucrative part of the Agile and DevOps game, and which they reckon will be hitting the flush financial services sector anytime now.
